User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

Similar to bug 65781
The design of the password sync dialog box, including when it appears (randomly to this user) provides an attack surface for even an unsophisticated phishing exploit.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable password sync
2. Restart browser
3. Attempt to predict when the "Enter master password" prompt will appear


Expected Results:  
1) The dialog box should be instantiated in such a way as to prevent duplication by kindergarden-level javascript. By this I mean UI elements that cannot be accessed by user mode code.
2) The password prompt should be predictable by the user. It's one thing to navigate to a site, with the expectation of logging in, then be presented with a dialog box. It's quite another to be prompted at random intervals for the master password.

This is not an enhancement request; this is a bug that should be fixed. The dialog box design and implementation represents a signification exploit vector given the increasing sophistication of [spear] phishing attacks.
comments.author: jchimene@gmail.com
